intro: Gladiolus andringitrae, commonly known as the Andringitra gladiolus, is a rare and endemic species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, sword-shaped leaves and tall, colorful flower spikes. The plant typically blooms in the dry season, producing showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange. It thrives in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the unique climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species.
